   17743             :     {
   17744          16 :         return ptr.get_checked(this);
   17745             :     }
   17746             : 
   17747             :     /*!
   17748             :     @brief return flattened JSON value
   17749             : 
   17750             :     The function creates a JSON object whose keys are JSON pointers (see [RFC
   17751             :     6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)) and whose values are all
   17752             :     primitive. The original JSON value can be restored using the @ref
   17753             :     unflatten() function.
   17754             : 
   17755             :     @return an object that maps JSON pointers to primitive values
   17756             : 
   17757             :     @note Empty objects and arrays are flattened to `null` and will not be
   17758             :           reconstructed correctly by the @ref unflatten() function.
   17759             : 
   17760             :     @complexity Linear in the size the JSON value.
   17761             : 
   17762             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON object is flattened to an
   17763             :     object whose keys consist of JSON pointers.,flatten}
   17764             : 
   17765             :     @sa @ref unflatten() for the reverse function
   17766             : 
   17767             :     @since version 2.0.0
   17768             :     */
   17769           9 :     basic_json flatten() const
   17770             :     {
   17771           9 :         basic_json result(value_t::object);
   17772           9 :         json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
   17773           9 :         return result;
   17774             :     }
   17775             : 
   17776             :     /*!
   17777             :     @brief unflatten a previously flattened JSON value
   17778             : 
   17779             :     The function restores the arbitrary nesting of a JSON value that has been
   17780             :     flattened before using the @ref flatten() function. The JSON value must
   17781             :     meet certain constraints:
   17782             :     1. The value must be an object.
   17783             :     2. The keys must be JSON pointers (see
   17784             :        [RFC 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901))
   17785             :     3. The mapped values must be primitive JSON types.
   17786             : 
   17787             :     @return the original JSON from a flattened version
   17788             : 
   17789             :     @note Empty objects and arrays are flattened by @ref flatten() to `null`
   17790             :           values and can not unflattened to their original type. Apart from
   17791             :           this example, for a JSON value `j`, the following is always true:
   17792             :           `j == j.flatten().unflatten()`.
   17793             : 
   17794             :     @complexity Linear in the size the JSON value.
   17795             : 
   17796             :     @throw type_error.314  if value is not an object
   17797             :     @throw type_error.315  if object values are not primitive
   17798             : 
   17799             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a flattened JSON object is
   17800             :     unflattened into the original nested JSON object.,unflatten}
   17801             : 
   17802             :     @sa @ref flatten() for the reverse function
   17803             : 
   17804             :     @since version 2.0.0
   17805             :     */
   17806          12 :     basic_json unflatten() const
   17807             :     {
   17808          12 :         return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
   17809             :     }
   17810             : 
   17811             :     /// @}
   17812             : 
   17813             :     //////////////////////////
   17814             :     // JSON Patch functions //
   17815             :     //////////////////////////
   17816             : 
   17817             :     /// @name JSON Patch functions
   17818             :     /// @{
   17819             : 
   17820             :     /*!
   17821             :     @brief applies a JSON patch
   17822             : 
   17823             :     [JSON Patch](http://jsonpatch.com) defines a JSON document structure for
   17824             :     expressing a sequence of operations to apply to a JSON) document. With
   17825             :     this function, a JSON Patch is applied to the current JSON value by
   17826             :     executing all operations from the patch.
   17827             : 
   17828             :     @param[in] json_patch  JSON patch document
   17829             :     @return patched document
   17830             : 
   17831             :     @note The application of a patch is atomic: Either all operations succeed
   17832             :           and the patched document is returned or an exception is thrown. In
   17833             :           any case, the original value is not changed: the patch is applied
   17834             :           to a copy of the value.
   17835             : 
   17836             :     @throw parse_error.104 if the JSON patch does not consist of an array of
   17837             :     objects
   17838             : 
   17839             :     @throw parse_error.105 if the JSON patch is malformed (e.g., mandatory
   17840             :     attributes are missing); example: `"operation add must have member path"`
   17841             : 
   17842             :     @throw out_of_range.401 if an array index is out of range.
   17843             : 
   17844             :     @throw out_of_range.403 if a JSON pointer inside the patch could not be
   17845             :     resolved successfully in the current JSON value; example: `"key baz not
   17846             :     found"`
   17847             : 
   17848             :     @throw out_of_range.405 if JSON pointer has no parent ("add", "remove",
   17849             :     "move")
   17850             : 
   17851             :     @throw other_error.501 if "test" operation was unsuccessful
   17852             : 
   17853             :     @complexity Linear in the size of the JSON value and the length of the
   17854             :     JSON patch. As usually only a fraction of the JSON value is affected by
   17855             :     the patch, the complexity can usually be neglected.
   17856             : 
   17857             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON patch is applied to a
   17858             :     value.,patch}
   17859             : 
   17860             :     @sa @ref diff -- create a JSON patch by comparing two JSON values
   17861             : 
   17862             :     @sa [RFC 6902 (JSON Patch)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902)
   17863             :     @sa [RFC 6901 (JSON Pointer)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)
   17864             : 
   17865             :     @since version 2.0.0
   17866             :     */
   17867         203 :     basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
   17868             :     {
   17869             :         // make a working copy to apply the patch to
   17870         203 :         basic_json result = *this;
   17871             : 
   17872             :         // the valid JSON Patch operations
   17873             :         enum class patch_operations {add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid};
   17874             : 
   17875         207 :         const auto get_op = [](const std::string & op)
   17876             :         {
   17877         207 :             if (op == "add")
   17878             :             {
   17879          69 :                 return patch_operations::add;
   17880             :             }
   17881         138 :             if (op == "remove")
   17882             :             {
   17883          32 :                 return patch_operations::remove;
   17884             :             }
   17885         106 :             if (op == "replace")
   17886             :             {
   17887          36 :                 return patch_operations::replace;
   17888             :             }
   17889          70 :             if (op == "move")
   17890             :             {
   17891          17 :                 return patch_operations::move;
   17892             :             }
   17893          53 :             if (op == "copy")
   17894             :             {
   17895          12 :                 return patch_operations::copy;
   17896             :             }
   17897          41 :             if (op == "test")
   17898             :             {
   17899          39 :                 return patch_operations::test;
   17900             :             }
   17901             : 
   17902           2 :             return patch_operations::invalid;
   17903             :         };
   17904             : 
   17905             :         // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
   17906         287 :         const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer & ptr, basic_json val)
   17907         108 :         {
   17908             :             // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
   17909          84 :             if (ptr.is_root())
   17910             :             {
   17911           8 :                 result = val;
   17912             :             }
   17913             :             else
   17914             :             {
   17915             :                 // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
   17916         160 :                 json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
   17917          80 :                 if (top_pointer != ptr)
   17918             :                 {
   17919          30 :                     result.at(top_pointer);
   17920             :                 }
   17921             : 
   17922             :                 // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
   17923         148 :                 const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
   17924          74 :                 basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
   17925             : 
   17926          74 :                 switch (parent.m_type)
   17927             :                 {
   17928          46 :                     case value_t::null:
   17929             :                     case value_t::object:
   17930             :                     {
   17931             :                         // use operator[] to add value
   17932          46 :                         parent[last_path] = val;
   17933          46 :                         break;
   17934             :                     }
   17935             : 
   17936          28 :                     case value_t::array:
   17937             :                     {
   17938          28 :                         if (last_path == "-")
   17939             :                         {
   17940             :                             // special case: append to back
   17941           5 :                             parent.push_back(val);
   17942             :                         }
   17943             :                         else
   17944             :                         {
   17945          23 :                             const auto idx = json_pointer::array_index(last_path);
   17946          21 :                             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size()))
   17947             :                             {
   17948             :                                 // avoid undefined behavior
   17949           4 :                                 JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
   17950             :                             }
   17951             :                             else
   17952             :                             {
   17953             :                                 // default case: insert add offset
   17954          17 :                                 parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
   17955             :                             }
   17956             :                         }
   17957          22 :                         break;
   17958             :                     }
   17959             : 
   17960             :                     default: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
   17961             :                     {
   17962             :                         // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
   17963             :                         assert(false);  // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
   17964             :                     }
   17965             :                 }
   17966             :             }
   17967          72 :         };
   17968             : 
   17969             :         // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
   17970         246 :         const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer & ptr)
   17971          42 :         {
   17972             :             // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
   17973          85 :             const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
   17974          42 :             basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
   17975             : 
   17976             :             // remove child
   17977          41 :             if (parent.is_object())
   17978             :             {
   17979             :                 // perform range check
   17980          26 :                 auto it = parent.find(last_path);
   17981          26 :                 if (JSON_LIKELY(it != parent.end()))
   17982             :                 {
   17983          24 :                     parent.erase(it);
   17984             :                 }
   17985             :                 else
   17986             :                 {
   17987           2 :                     JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
   17988             :                 }
   17989             :             }
   17990          15 :             else if (parent.is_array())
   17991             :             {
   17992             :                 // note erase performs range check
   17993          15 :                 parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(json_pointer::array_index(last_path)));
   17994             :             }
   17995          36 :         };
   17996             : 
   17997             :         // type check: top level value must be an array
   17998         203 :         if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not json_patch.is_array()))
   17999             :         {
   18000           1 :             JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
   18001             :         }
   18002             : 
   18003             :         // iterate and apply the operations
   18004         356 :         for (const auto& val : json_patch)
   18005             :         {
   18006             :             // wrapper to get a value for an operation
   18007         222 :             const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string & op,
   18008             :                                           const std::string & member,
   18009         613 :                                           bool string_type) -> basic_json &
   18010        1226 :             {
   18011             :                 // find value
   18012         613 :                 auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
   18013             : 
   18014             :                 // context-sensitive error message
   18015        1226 :                 const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
   18016             : 
   18017             :                 // check if desired value is present
   18018         613 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it == val.m_value.object->end()))
   18019             :                 {
   18020          18 :                     JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
   18021             :                 }
   18022             : 
   18023             :                 // check if result is of type string
   18024         595 :                 if (JSON_UNLIKELY(string_type and not it->second.is_string()))
   18025             :                 {
   18026           9 :                     JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
   18027             :                 }
   18028             : 
   18029             :                 // no error: return value
   18030        1172 :                 return it->second;
   18031             :             };
   18032             : 
   18033             :             // type check: every element of the array must be an object
   18034         222 :             if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not val.is_object()))
   18035             :             {
   18036           1 :                 JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
   18037             :             }
   18038             : 
   18039             :             // collect mandatory members
   18040         442 :             const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
   18041         438 :             const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
   18042         414 :             json_pointer ptr(path);
   18043             : 
   18044         207 :             switch (get_op(op))
   18045             :             {
   18046          69 :                 case patch_operations::add:
   18047             :                 {
   18048          79 :                     operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
   18049          57 :                     break;
   18050             :                 }
   18051             : 
   18052          32 :                 case patch_operations::remove:
   18053             :                 {
   18054          32 :                     operation_remove(ptr);
   18055          25 :                     break;
   18056             :                 }
   18057             : 
   18058          36 :                 case patch_operations::replace:
   18059             :                 {
   18060             :                     // the "path" location must exist - use at()
   18061          40 :                     result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
   18062          30 :                     break;
   18063             :                 }
   18064             : 
   18065          17 :                 case patch_operations::move:
   18066             :                 {
   18067          34 :                     const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
   18068          28 :                     json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
   18069             : 
   18070             :                     // the "from" location must exist - use at()
   18071          25 :                     basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
   18072             : 
   18073             :                     // The move operation is functionally identical to a
   18074             :                     // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
   18075             :                     // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
   18076             :                     // location with the value that was just removed.
   18077          11 :                     operation_remove(from_ptr);
   18078          12 :                     operation_add(ptr, v);
   18079          10 :                     break;
   18080             :                 }
   18081             : 
   18082          12 :                 case patch_operations::copy:
   18083             :                 {
   18084          24 :                     const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
   18085          18 :                     const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
   18086             : 
   18087             :                     // the "from" location must exist - use at()
   18088          15 :                     basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
   18089             : 
   18090             :                     // The copy is functionally identical to an "add"
   18091             :                     // operation at the target location using the value
   18092             :                     // specified in the "from" member.
   18093           7 :                     operation_add(ptr, v);
   18094           5 :                     break;
   18095             :                 }
   18096             : 
   18097          39 :                 case patch_operations::test:
   18098             :                 {
   18099          39 :                     bool success = false;
   18100             :                     JSON_TRY
   18101             :                     {
   18102             :                         // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
   18103             :                         // the "path" location must exist - use at()
   18104          46 :                         success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
   18105             :                     }
   18106           2 :                     JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
   18107             :                     {
   18108             :                         // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
   18109             :                     }
   18110             : 
   18111             :                     // throw an exception if test fails
   18112          34 :                     if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not success))
   18113             :                     {
   18114           7 :                         JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
   18115             :                     }
   18116             : 
   18117          27 :                     break;
   18118             :                 }
   18119             : 
   18120           2 :                 case patch_operations::invalid:
   18121             :                 {
   18122             :                     // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
   18123             :                     // "test"
   18124           2 :                     JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
   18125             :                 }
   18126             :             }
   18127             :         }
   18128             : 
   18129         134 :         return result;
   18130             :     }
   18131             : 
   18132             :     /*!
   18133             :     @brief creates a diff as a JSON patch
   18134             : 
   18135             :     Creates a [JSON Patch](http://jsonpatch.com) so that value @a source can
   18136             :     be changed into the value @a target by calling @ref patch function.
   18137             : 
   18138             :     @invariant For two JSON values @a source and @a target, the following code
   18139             :     yields always `true`:
   18140             :     @code {.cpp}
   18141             :     source.patch(diff(source, target)) == target;
   18142             :     @endcode
   18143             : 
   18144             :     @note Currently, only `remove`, `add`, and `replace` operations are
   18145             :           generated.
   18146             : 
   18147             :     @param[in] source  JSON value to compare from
   18148             :     @param[in] target  JSON value to compare against
   18149             :     @param[in] path    helper value to create JSON pointers
   18150             : 
   18151             :     @return a JSON patch to convert the @a source to @a target
   18152             : 
   18153             :     @complexity Linear in the lengths of @a source and @a target.
   18154             : 
   18155             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON patch is created as a
   18156             :     diff for two JSON values.,diff}
   18157             : 
   18158             :     @sa @ref patch -- apply a JSON patch
   18159             :     @sa @ref merge_patch -- apply a JSON Merge Patch
   18160             : 
   18161             :     @sa [RFC 6902 (JSON Patch)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902)
   18162             : 
   18163             :     @since version 2.0.0
   18164             :     */
   18165          68 :     static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target,
   18166             :                            const std::string& path = "")
   18167             :     {
   18168             :         // the patch
   18169          68 :         basic_json result(value_t::array);
   18170             : 
   18171             :         // if the values are the same, return empty patch
   18172          68 :         if (source == target)
   18173             :         {
   18174          24 :             return result;
   18175             :         }
   18176             : 
   18177          44 :         if (source.type() != target.type())
   18178             :         {
   18179             :             // different types: replace value
   18180           2 :             result.push_back(
   18181             :             {
   18182             :                 {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
   18183             :             });
   18184             :         }
   18185             :         else
   18186             :         {
   18187          42 :             switch (source.type())
   18188             :             {
   18189           8 :                 case value_t::array:
   18190             :                 {
   18191             :                     // first pass: traverse common elements
   18192           8 :                     std::size_t i = 0;
   18193          44 :                     while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
   18194             :                     {
   18195             :                         // recursive call to compare array values at index i
   18196          36 :                         auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
   18197          18 :                         result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
   18198          18 :                         ++i;
   18199             :                     }
   18200             : 
   18201             :                     // i now reached the end of at least one array
   18202             :                     // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
   18203             : 
   18204             :                     // remove my remaining elements
   18205           8 :                     const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
   18206          14 :                     while (i < source.size())
   18207             :                     {
   18208             :                         // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
   18209             :                         // indices
   18210           3 :                         result.insert(result.begin() + end_index, object(
   18211             :                         {
   18212             :                             {"op", "remove"},
   18213             :                             {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}
   18214             :                         }));
   18215           3 :                         ++i;
   18216             :                     }
   18217             : 
   18218             :                     // add other remaining elements
   18219          16 :                     while (i < target.size())
   18220             :                     {
   18221           8 :                         result.push_back(
   18222             :                         {
   18223             :                             {"op", "add"},
   18224             :                             {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
   18225           4 :                             {"value", target[i]}
   18226             :                         });
   18227           4 :                         ++i;
   18228             :                     }
   18229             : 
   18230           8 :                     break;
   18231             :                 }
   18232             : 
   18233          25 :                 case value_t::object:
   18234             :                 {
   18235             :                     // first pass: traverse this object's elements
   18236          59 :                     for (auto it = source.cbegin(); it != source.cend(); ++it)
   18237             :                     {
   18238             :                         // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
   18239          68 :                         const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
   18240             : 
   18241          34 :                         if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
   18242             :                         {
   18243             :                             // recursive call to compare object values at key it
   18244          54 :                             auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
   18245          27 :                             result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
   18246             :                         }
   18247             :                         else
   18248             :                         {
   18249             :                             // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
   18250           7 :                             result.push_back(object(
   18251             :                             {
   18252             :                                 {"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}
   18253             :                             }));
   18254             :                         }
   18255             :                     }
   18256             : 
   18257             :                     // second pass: traverse other object's elements
   18258          61 :                     for (auto it = target.cbegin(); it != target.cend(); ++it)
   18259             :                     {
   18260          36 :                         if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
   18261             :                         {
   18262             :                             // found a key that is not in this -> add it
   18263          18 :                             const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
   18264           9 :                             result.push_back(
   18265             :                             {
   18266             :                                 {"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + key},
   18267             :                                 {"value", it.value()}
   18268             :                             });
   18269             :                         }
   18270             :                     }
   18271             : 
   18272          25 :                     break;
   18273             :                 }
   18274             : 
   18275           9 :                 default:
   18276             :                 {
   18277             :                     // both primitive type: replace value
   18278           9 :                     result.push_back(
   18279             :                     {
   18280             :                         {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
   18281             :                     });
   18282           9 :                     break;
   18283             :                 }
   18284             :             }
   18285             :         }
   18286             : 
   18287          44 :         return result;
   18288             :     }
   18289             : 
   18290             :     /// @}
   18291             : 
   18292             :     ////////////////////////////////
   18293             :     // JSON Merge Patch functions //
   18294             :     ////////////////////////////////
   18295             : 
   18296             :     /// @name JSON Merge Patch functions
   18297             :     /// @{
   18298             : 
   18299             :     /*!
   18300             :     @brief applies a JSON Merge Patch
   18301             : 
   18302             :     The merge patch format is primarily intended for use with the HTTP PATCH
   18303             :     method as a means of describing a set of modifications to a target
   18304             :     resource's content. This function applies a merge patch to the current
   18305             :     JSON value.
   18306             : 
   18307             :     The function implements the following algorithm from Section 2 of
   18308             :     [RFC 7396 (JSON Merge Patch)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7396):
   18309             : 
   18310             :     ```
   18311             :     define MergePatch(Target, Patch):
   18312             :       if Patch is an Object:
   18313             :         if Target is not an Object:
   18314             :           Target = {} // Ignore the contents and set it to an empty Object
   18315             :         for each Name/Value pair in Patch:
   18316             :           if Value is null:
   18317             :             if Name exists in Target:
   18318             :               remove the Name/Value pair from Target
   18319             :           else:
   18320             :             Target[Name] = MergePatch(Target[Name], Value)
   18321             :         return Target
   18322             :       else:
   18323             :         return Patch
   18324             :     ```
   18325             : 
   18326             :     Thereby, `Target` is the current object; that is, the patch is applied to
   18327             :     the current value.
   18328             : 
   18329             :     @param[in] patch  the patch to apply
   18330             : 
   18331             :     @complexity Linear in the lengths of @a patch.
   18332             : 
   18333             :     @liveexample{The following code shows how a JSON Merge Patch is applied to
   18334             :     a JSON document.,merge_patch}
   18335             : 
   18336             :     @sa @ref patch -- apply a JSON patch
   18337             :     @sa [RFC 7396 (JSON Merge Patch)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7396)
   18338             : 
   18339             :     @since version 3.0.0
   18340             :     */
   18341          34 :     void merge_patch(const basic_json& patch)
   18342             :     {
   18343          34 :         if (patch.is_object())
   18344             :         {
   18345          18 :             if (not is_object())
   18346             :             {
   18347           3 :                 *this = object();
   18348             :             }
   18349          42 :             for (auto it = patch.begin(); it != patch.end(); ++it)
   18350             :             {
   18351          24 :                 if (it.value().is_null())
   18352             :                 {
   18353           7 :                     erase(it.key());
   18354             :                 }
   18355             :                 else
   18356             :                 {
   18357          17 :                     operator[](it.key()).merge_patch(it.value());
   18358             :                 }
   18359             :             }
   18360             :         }
   18361             :         else
   18362             :         {
   18363          16 :             *this = patch;
   18364             :         }
   18365          34 :     }
   18366             : 
   18367             :     /// @}
   18368             : };
   18369             : } // namespace nlohmann
   18370             : 
   18371             : ///////////////////////

   18381             : @since version 1.0.0
   18382             : */
   18383             : template<>
   18384          15 : inline void swap(nlohmann::json& j1,
   18385             :                  nlohmann::json& j2) noexcept(
   18386             :                      is_nothrow_move_constructible<nlohmann::json>::value and
   18387             :                      is_nothrow_move_assignable<nlohmann::json>::value
   18388             :                  )
   18389             : {
   18390          15 :     j1.swap(j2);
   18391          15 : }
   18392             : 
   18393             : /// hash value for JSON objects
   18394             : template<>

   18396             : {
   18397             :     /*!
   18398             :     @brief return a hash value for a JSON object
   18399             : 
   18400             :     @since version 1.0.0
   18401             :     */
   18402           6 :     std::size_t operator()(const nlohmann::json& j) const
   18403             :     {
   18404             :         // a naive hashing via the string representation
   18405           6 :         const auto& h = hash<nlohmann::json::string_t>();
   18406           6 :         return h(j.dump());
   18407             :     }
   18408             : };
   18409             : 
   18410             : /// specialization for std::less<value_t>
   18411             : /// @note: do not remove the space after '<',
   18412             : ///        see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/679
   18413             : template<>
   18414             : struct less< ::nlohmann::detail::value_t>
   18415             : {
   18416             :     /*!
   18417             :     @brief compare two value_t enum values
   18418             :     @since version 3.0.0
   18419             :     */
   18420          64 :     bool operator()(nlohmann::detail::value_t lhs,
   18421             :                     nlohmann::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept
   18422             :     {
   18423          64 :         return nlohmann::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
   18424             :     }
   18425             : };
   18426             : 
   18427             : } // namespace std
   18428             : 
   18429             : /*!
   18430             : @brief user-defined string literal for JSON values
   18431             : 
   18432             : This operator implements a user-defined string literal for JSON objects. It
   18433             : can be used by adding `"_json"` to a string literal and returns a JSON object
   18434             : if no parse error occurred.
   18435             : 
   18436             : @param[in] s  a string representation of a JSON object
   18437             : @param[in] n  the length of string @a s
   18438             : @return a JSON object
   18439             : 
   18440             : @since version 1.0.0
   18441             : */
   18442         189 : inline nlohmann::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
   18443             : {
   18444         189 :     return nlohmann::json::parse(s, s + n);
   18445             : }
   18446             : 
   18447             : /*!
   18448             : @brief user-defined string literal for JSON pointer
   18449             : 
   18450             : This operator implements a user-defined string literal for JSON Pointers. It
   18451             : can be used by adding `"_json_pointer"` to a string literal and returns a JSON pointer
   18452             : object if no parse error occurred.
   18453             : 
   18454             : @param[in] s  a string representation of a JSON Pointer
   18455             : @param[in] n  the length of string @a s
   18456             : @return a JSON pointer object
   18457             : 
   18458             : @since version 2.0.0
   18459             : */
   18460          93 : inline nlohmann::json::json_pointer operator "" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n)
   18461             : {
   18462          93 :     return nlohmann::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
   18463             : }
   18464             :
